channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour Might Affect Europe’s Economy
item.description: Economists are debating what effect the singer’s sweep through Europe will have this summer as swarms of fans increase demand for hotels and services.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Netanyahu Feuds With Allies as Questions Mount Over War’s Future
item.description: The Israeli leader’s quarrels with the White House, his military and his coalition partners have escalated at a pivotal time in the war in Gaza.

item.title: Trump proposed excluding tips from federal taxes. Here’s what that would mean for workers’ take-home pay—and budget deficits
item.description: The Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget, a fiscal watchdog group, has estimated that exempting tips from both income and payroll taxes would reduce federal revenues by $150-$250 billion over the next decade.

item.title: In Japan, These Women Want to Opt Out of Motherhood More Easily
item.description: A lawsuit challenges the onerous requirements for getting sterilized, calling the regulations paternalistic and a violation of women’s constitutional rights.

item.title: In Japan, These Women Want to Opt Out of Motherhood More Easily
item.description: A lawsuit challenges the onerous requirements for getting sterilized, calling the regulations paternalistic and a violation of women’s constitutional rights.

item.title: In Spain, where one in five toddlers aged 3 or 4 owns a smartphone, thousands of parents have united to say ‘no’
item.description: The push to control smartphones in Spain comes amid a surge in cases of children viewing online pornography, sharing videos of sexual violence, or in creating deepfakes.

item.title: Trump Narrows Biden’s Cash Lead, and Heat Shatters Records
item.description: Plus, the Taylor Swift inflation effect.

item.title: Swiss Judge Set to Rule in Hinduja Family Human-Trafficking Trial
item.description: The Hinduja family has denied allegations against four members that they trafficked domestic workers from India and exploited them at their villa in Geneva.

item.title: Martha’s Vineyard rentals have gotten so expensive a correctional officer switched to cleaning to earn less so she didn’t lose access to low-income housing
item.description: Landlords stand to make far more money from short-term tourists than from year-round residents. And many island homes are almost always vacant, their wealthy owners uninterested in renting them between fleeting visits.

item.title: NJ Transit and Amtrak Service Suspended Due to Power Issues
item.description: Service was largely restored by Friday morning, though some trains were still canceled.

item.title: What the Mood Is Like in Iran Ahead of Presidential Elections
item.description: A special presidential election campaign is featuring blistering attacks on the status quo by conservatives and the lone reformer alike.

item.title: Mothers are back at work. Here’s why we shouldn’t be too quick to celebrate
item.description: In the absence of a social safety net, moms end up filling low-wage, no-benefit, dead-end jobs in retail, food service, home health, and childcare.

item.title: What the Mood Is Like in Iran Ahead of Presidential Elections
item.description: A special presidential election campaign is featuring blistering attacks on the status quo by conservatives and the lone reformer alike.

item.title: Well Beyond the U.S., Heat and Climate Extremes Are Hitting Billions
item.description: People all over the world are facing severe heat, floods and fire, aggravated by the use of fossil fuels. The year isn’t halfway done.

item.title: Why going cashless has turned Sweden from one of the safest countries into a high-crime nation
item.description: In just a decade fraud has almost doubled from just under 9,000 to over 23,000 in 2023.
